snippet: The Afghan Attorney General’s Office later banned the correspondent, Matthew Rosenberg, from leaving the country over objections to his reporting.
abstract: Afghan attorney general's office calls in New York Times correspondent Matthew Rosenberg for questioning and bars him from leaving country; move follows publication in The Times of an article about discussions among powerful figures in Afghan government contemplating formation of a temporary governing committee.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Afghan Attorney General’s Office later banned the correspondent, Matthew Rosenberg, from leaving the country over objections to his reporting.

headline.main: Afghan Officials Interrogate a Times Correspondent
headline.print_headline: Afghan Officials Interrogate a Times Correspondent
